text.body: Was leader Soviet Union mid s until his death

Among Bolshevik revolutionaries who took part Russian Revolution Stalin appointed general secretary party s Central Committee He subsequently managed to consolidate power following death Vladimir Lenin through suppressing Lenin s criticisms in postscript his testament expanding functions his role all while eliminating any opposition
By late s he unchallenged leader Soviet Union He remained general secretary until post abolished concurrently serving as Premier Soviet Union onward

Under Stalin s rule concept socialism one country became central tenet Soviet society He replaced New Economic Policy introduced by Lenin early s highly centralised command economy launching period industrialization collectivization resulted rapid transformation USSR agrarian society into industrial power

The initial upheaval agriculture disrupted food production contributed to catastrophic Soviet famine known as Holodomor Ukraine Later period lasted to Stalin instituted campaign against alleged enemies within his regime called Great Purge hundreds thousands were executed

Germany later violated agreement launched massive invasion Soviet Union June Despite heavy human territorial losses Soviet forces managed to halt Nazi incursion after decisive Battles Moscow Stalingrad

After defeating Axis powers on Eastern Front Red Army captured Berlin May effectively ending war Europe Allies Soviet Union subsequently emerged as one two recognized world superpowers other being United States

Stalin led Soviet Union through post war reconstruction phase saw significant rise tension Western world later be known as Cold War During period USSR became second country world to successfully develop nuclear weapon as well as launching Great Plan Transformation Nature response to another widespread famine Great Construction Projects Communism

Stalin played decisive role engineering Red Army invasion Georgia following he adopted particularly hardline centralist policies towards Soviet Georgia led to Georgian Affair other repressions Stalin s actions Georgia created rift Lenin who believed all Soviet states should stand equal

The Northern Expedition China became point contention over foreign policy by Stalin Trotsky Stalin wanted Communist Party China to ally itself Nationalist Kuomintang rather than attempt to implement communist revolution

The eastern part Poland Latvia Estonia Finland part Romania were recognized as parts Soviet sphere influence Lithuania added second secret protocol September Stalin Ribbentrop traded toasts on night signing discussing past hostilities between countries

On September German invasion agreed upon portion Poland started World War II On September Red Army invaded eastern Poland occupied Polish territory assigned to by Molotov Ribbentrop Pact followed by co ordination German forces Poland
After Stalin declared he going to solve Baltic problem by June Lithuania Latvia Estonia were merged into Soviet Union after repressions actions therein brought deaths over citizens these states

After campaign Stalin took actions to bolster Soviet military modify training improve propaganda efforts Soviet military June Stalin directed Soviet annexation Bessarabia northern Bukovina proclaiming formerly Romanian territory part Moldavian Soviet Socialist Republic But annexing northern Bukovina Stalin gone beyond agreed limits secret protocol

On May Stalin replaced Molotov as Premier Soviet Union Although Stalin been de facto head government decade half he concluded relations Nazi Germany deteriorated to such extent he needed to deal problem as de jure head government as well
During early morning June Adolf Hitler broke pact by implementing Operation Barbarossa German invasion Soviet held territories Soviet Union began war on Eastern Front
Already autumn Stalin received warning Dutch Communist Party via network Red Orchestra Hitler preparing winter war by letting construct thousands snow landing gears Junkers Ju transport planes

Although Stalin received warnings spies his generals he felt Germany attack Soviet Union until Germany defeated Britain initial hours after German attack commenced Stalin hesitated wanting to ensure German attack sanctioned by Hitler rather than unauthorized action rogue general

While Germans pressed forward Stalin confident eventual Allied victory over Germany September Stalin told British diplomats he wanted two agreements mutual assistance aid pact recognition after war Soviet Union gain territories countries taken pursuant to division Eastern Europe Hitler Molotov Ribbentrop Pact

In Hitler shifted his primary goal immediate victory East to more long term goal securing southern Soviet Union to conquer oil fields vital to long term German war effort July Hitler praised efficiency Soviet military industry Stalin
